Texto: 
height is 121.6cm, weight is 22.9kg.  patient appears very petite with normal appearing body proportions.  deep tendon reflexes are 2+. thyroid function tests were normal.  sexual development: tanner stage i.  bone age performed at a chronological age of 9 years, 3 months was determined to be 8 years, 4 months.   igf-1 was less than 20 and cortisol level drawn at 12:00pm was 9.5
continue current thyroid hormone regimen and re-initiate treatment with growth hormone.
mri of brain and sella with and without contrast revealed anterior pituitary height of less than 1mm
empty sella syndrome
o	pituitary hypoplasia
o	prolactinoma
o	pseudotumor cerebri
o	idiopathic intracranial hypertension
8 year old female with a history of hypothyroidism and severe short stature.  she has been lost to follow-up for three years but was restarted on synthroid three months ago.  now she is being seen by endocrinologist for short stature.
there are a variety of clinical manifestations associated with ess and definitive diagnosis is often delayed while patients undergo an extensive evaluation to determine the cause of their symptoms. endocrine abnormalities are common; in this case, the patient presented with signs and symptoms consistent with hypothyroidism and growth hormone deficiency.
